files.description: Project overview and step-by-step instructions to run the included reproducible toy-model experiments and reproduce plots/tables.
Pinned minimal Python dependencies required to run all numerical and symbolic experiments and generate outputs.
Command-line entrypoint that runs selected experiments, manages seeds/output directories, and saves plots/tables deterministically.
Utilities for reproducible experiment runs including seeding, structured result saving (CSV/JSON), and output directory management.
Plotting helpers for consistent styling and saving of figures generated by the toy experiments.
Graph/lattice construction utilities used by emergence and entanglement-structure diagnostics experiments.
Lightweight quantum-state utilities (state preparation, partial trace, entropy/mutual information, simple evolutions) for entanglement diagnostics.
Reproducible toy experiments computing entanglement entropy and mutual information across partitions for small quantum spin chains and graph states.
Symbolic/numeric toy renormalization-flow experiment (e.g., 1D Ising decimation and beta-function visualization) producing tables/plots.
Small-scale lattice/graph model demonstrating emergence of classicality via decoherence/pointer-basis diagnostics under simple environment coupling rules.
Example shell script invoking the CLI to run all experiments and reproduce the example outputs into a single output folder.
Example outputs guide showing the plots/tables each experiment produces and how to interpret the diagnostics at a high level.

missionDescription: Implement prototype numerical / symbolic experiments that illustrate the behavior or consequences of the most promising candidate framework(s). This may include: toy-model simulations, symbolic derivations (e.g., effective action, renormalization flow), entanglement structure diagnostics, or small-scale lattice/graph models demonstrating emergence of classicality from quantum rules. Produce reproducible code and example outputs (plots, tables).
missionSuccessCriteria: Includes executable code (Python script or Jupyter notebook) with clear documentation, parameters, and example outputs. Code should be runnable and produce expected results.
Includes data visualizations or figures (PNG, SVG, or described in detail) that effectively communicate findings.
